title: Web Scraper Input
description: Web Scraper loads Start URLs in the Chrome browser and executes Page function on each page to extract data from it. To follow links and scrape additional pages, set Link selector with Pseudo-URLs to specify which links to follow. Alternatively, you can manually enqueue new links in Page function. For details, see actor's README or Web scraping tutorial in the Apify documentation.

startUrls.title: Start URLs
startUrls.description:
URLs to begin scraping.

For details, see Start URLs

maxCrawlingDepth.title: Page suivante: how many times ?
maxCrawlingDepth.description: How many times we click on 'next page'. 0 is until the end of leboncoin pagination.

proxyConfiguration.title: Choose 'Custom proxies' and get FRENCH ones
proxyConfiguration.description:
Proxy servers to have a FRENCH IP, otherwise leboncoin will block you.

For details, see Proxy configuration.

Should look like this : 'http://groups-RESIDENTIAL,country-FR:mmmdWt2t3Q83GNxTiuuyCZCghh@proxy.apify.com:8000'

pseudoUrls.title: Respect URL pattern
pseudoUrls.description:
Specifies what kind of URLs found by Link selector should be added to the request queue. A pseudo-URL is a URL with regular expressions enclosed in [] brackets, e.g. http://www.example.com/[.*].

If Pseudo-URLs are omitted, the actor enqueues all links matched by the Link selector 'Page Suivante'.

For details, see Pseudo-URLs.

maxPagesPerCrawl.title: Max pages
maxPagesPerCrawl.description:
Maximum number of pages that the scraper will load. It will stop when this limit is reached (prevent excess platform usage for misconfigured scrapers).

If 0, there is no limit.

pageFunction.title: Function
pageFunction.description:
JavaScript function executed on every page (inside the Chrome browser). Customise it if necessary.

For details, see Page function

runMode.title: Debugging
runMode.description:
Indicates the scraper's mode of operation. In DEVELOPMENT mode, the scraper ignores page timeouts, doesn't use sessionPool, opens pages one by one and enables debugging via Chrome DevTools. Open the live view tab or the container URL to access the debugger. Further debugging options can be configured in the Advanced configuration section. PRODUCTION mode disables debugging and enables timeouts and concurrency.

For details, see Run mode in README.
